item.title: Best Games For Feeling Alive
item.description:
Summary

  • The Last of Us Part I creates tension through scarcity and emotional depth, setting a new narrative standard in gaming.
  • Uncharted 4 blends blockbuster action with mature storytelling about letting go and growing older, leaving fans captivated.
  • Elden Ring redefines what it means to feel alive in its hostile world, providing a thrill of discovery and mastery rather than scripted sequences.

What does it truly mean for a video game to make us feel alive? It’s when games make their players feel like they're riding a roller coaster, shaking them out of their routine and into the moment. The best games for “feeling alive” go far beyond good graphics or clever mechanics. These are experiences that wake players from autopilot, plunging them headlong into adrenaline-pumping action, emotional gut-punches, and sprawling worlds that feel uncannily real.

From desperate, breathless stealth to the operatic chaos of demon-slaying, these games grip the senses and never let go. Some titles deliver this through tight, cinematic narratives that leave a lump in the throat; others, through sheer, sandbox freedom that invites glorious, unpredictable chaos. These eight games, ranked here, stand as proof that, in the right hands, a controller can give players all the rush they need—and then some more.

The Last of Us Part I

The Agonizing Tension of Fragile Survival

The Last of Us Part I
9 /10
21
9.6 /10
Released
September 2, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Use of Alcohol
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 5
Powered by

The Last of Us Part I earns its place not with the high-speed action, but with a slow-burning tension born from utter desperation. The sensation comes from vulnerability and scarcity. Every encounter is a gamble: Is it worth spending the last bullet, or will a misstep mean starting over? The moment a clicker’s telltale sound echoes through a decaying hallway, the pulse quickens, and survival becomes a minute-by-minute victory.

However, what really lingers is the emotional gut punch. The relationship between Joel and Ellie—rooted in trauma, hope, and everything in between—sets a new standard for narrative power in games. Environmental storytelling, enhanced further in the PS5 remake, makes the world feel as hauntingly real as it is dangerous.

Uncharted 4: A Thief's End

The Perfect Storm of Blockbuster Spectacle

6 Images
6 Images
Uncharted 4: A Thief's End
10 /10
13
9.2 /10
Released
May 10, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood, Language, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco, Violence
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5
Powered by

Uncharted 4 finds its spark not in fear, but in thrill. From leaping between trucks in a madcap chase across Madagascar to narrowly escaping collapsing ruins, every action scene hits with a palpable energy. What sets Uncharted 4 apart is the surprisingly mature emotional core. Beneath the explosions and gunfire is a tale about letting go, family, and growing older.

Nathan Drake’s final adventure is peppered with quiet moments—wandering through the attic of his home, reflecting on a life of obsession and adventure. The grappling hook isn’t just a tool; it’s a metaphor for hanging on and, eventually, moving forward. This masterful fusion of high-octane action with heartfelt, character-driven storytelling elevates the entire series and leaves fans wanting more.

Elden Ring

Forging an Epic Through the Majesty of a Hostile World

6 Images
6 Images
Elden Ring
10 /10
69
9.1 /10
Released
February 25, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series S, Xbox Series X
Powered by

Elden Ring makes the players feel alive by mixing awe and terror. It's adrenaline doesn't come from scripted cinematic sequences, but from the unyielding pressure of its majestic and deeply hostile world. The open world means players are free to run, explore, and fall into the jaws of something far stronger than them.

The game’s emotional resonance is earned, not handed out. Failure, frustration, and eventual mastery are all part of the epic. Elden Ring redefines the “alive” sensation: not just with jump scares or explosions, but with the thrill of true discovery and the satisfaction of overcoming impossible odds.

God of War Ragnarök

Mythic Clashes and Emotional Weight

6 Images
6 Images
God of War Ragnarok
10 /10
73
9.1 /10
Released
November 9, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5
Powered by

God of War Ragnarök is a true epic, delivering a feeling of aliveness through the weight of its combat and the profound depth of its storytelling. The deep and flexible combat system forces players to think tactically, switching between weapons and abilities to exploit enemy weaknesses.

This system reaches its zenith during the spectacular, cinematic boss encounters against figures from Norse mythology, which push player skill to the absolute limit. Ragnarök is both a spectacle and a meditation on breaking cycles—a game where the epic and the intimate collide. To play is to ride an emotional roller coaster, with moments that resonate long after the credits roll.

Cyberpunk 2077

A Fever Dream of Dystopian Urgency and Neon Chaos

6 Images
6 Images
Cyberpunk 2077
6 /10
112
8.9 /10
Released
December 10, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch 2, PC
Powered by

Cyberpunk 2077 offers a unique, feverish brand of aliveness. Night City is a sensory overload—neon lights, pounding music, and relentless danger at every turn. Combat is frenetic, with gunfights and hacking offering a wild variety. Whether slipping through alleys as a stealthy netrunner or going loud with tech weapons, every moment hums with tension.

The evolving relationship with Johnny Silverhand, plus side stories of love, loss, and rebellion, ground the spectacle in something intimate and real. Night City itself is the ultimate character: alive, dangerous, impossible to predict. Its vertical sprawl and modding potential invite endless exploration for the fans.

Grand Theft Auto V

Where Chaos and Crime Feel Like Freedom

5 Images
5 Images
Grand Theft Auto 5
9 /10
150
8.9 /10
Released
September 17, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Mature Humor, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Platform(s)
Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, Xbox 360, PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5
Powered by

Grand Theft Auto V has this unpredictable, emergent, and often hilarious rhythm of chaos. This game makes players feel alive not by forcing them into a desperate struggle for survival, but by handing them the keys to a sprawling, dynamic sandbox and empowering them to create their own adrenaline.

Los Santos is a living, breathing city—one that reacts, resists, and sometimes just gets in the way, forcing players to improvise and adapt. The narrative is sharp, often cynical, skewering everything from celebrity culture to politics. But the real magic is emergent: no two sessions, or escapes, ever play out the same.

Resident Evil 2 Remake

The Relentless, Heart-Stopping Dread of Being Hunted

5 Images
5 Images
Resident Evil 2
20
9.1 /10
Released
January 25, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Strong Language, Intense Violence
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

Resident Evil 2 Remake is a masterclass in sustained dread, delivering a feeling of tension that is pure, primal, and terrifyingly potent. The Raccoon City Police Department is a claustrophobic maze, alive with threats around every corner. But nothing spikes the heart rate like Mr. X, whose heavy footsteps stalk the player, turning each safe room into a fleeting illusion.

Emotional depth takes a backseat to raw sensation, but the feeling of being hunted, of scraping by with dwindling resources, is unforgettable. The remake’s over-the-shoulder camera and state-of-the-art sound design place players directly in the thick of the terror. By expertly blending classic survival horror mechanics with modern polish, Resident Evil 2 Remake sets a new standard for the genre.

Doom Eternal

Pure, Unstoppable Flow of Aggression and Glorious Violence

DOOM Eternal
9 /10
12
8.8 /10
Released
March 20, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence
Platform(s)
Xbox One, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Nintendo Switch
Powered by

Doom Eternal makes players feel alive by pushing them to the brink of death and then giving them the tools to claw their way back. Health, ammo, and armor are earned in the thick of battle, forcing players to stay in motion, exploit enemy weaknesses, and chain kills with ruthless efficiency. The result is a sensation best described as flow: everything clicks, and the player becomes the hunter, not the hunted.

Narrative and character arcs take a backseat to gameplay, but the emotional payoff is primal: rage, joy, triumph, and the giddy satisfaction of absolute mastery. Every arena is a demonic playground, packed with movement options, verticality, and weapons that demand creative problem-solving. Doom Eternal isn’t just the king of first-person shooters; it’s a masterclass in what happens when mechanics, sound, and art design all work in harmony to produce pure, electrifying fun.

item.title: The State of Louisiana Is Suing Roblox (Pokemon World Championships, Japanese McDonald's Scalpers)
item.description: The State of Louisiana is taking Roblox to court over its allegedly unsafe network, multiple Pokemon teams bow out before arrival, and Japan has an interesting problem regarding Happy Meals and Pokemon Cards. All this and more!

item.title: Pokemon Community Angered by Fan's Rare Shiny Rayquaza Encounter
item.description:
A Pokemon fan shared an absolutely infuriating video of their encounter with a Shiny Rayquaza, upsetting the Pokemon community in the process. The Pokemon Emerald mascot is quite popular, and fans who have dreamed of finding a Shiny version of it may be heartbroken by the fan's video.

Catching a Legendary in Pokemon games is always exciting, and Rayquaza is no exception to the rule. The challenge is made all the more difficult because just getting to the Pokemon can be tricky in Pokemon Emerald . Players have to zip through Sky Pillar on a Mach Bike to get past certain cracks in the floor that can send them plummeting back down to the ground floor. Once that puzzle is complete, fans can battle Rayquaza to capture it, but this player didn't follow the usual routine.

Pokemon Player's Shiny Rayquaza Encounter Upsets Fans

On Reddit, user CyZnRg shared a gameplay video demonstrating their run to get to Rayquaza. After making their way through Sky PIllar flawlessly, they started their encounter with Rayquaza, which turned out to be a Shiny. Since Rayquaza is a scripted encounter in this game, players only get one shot at the Pokemon being Shiny, and the odds of encountering any Shiny Pokemon are extremely low. Players were delighted by the discovery, but their happiness quickly came to an end as CyZnRg called on their Mewtwo to use Self Destruct, destroying the Rayquaza in one hit. After ending the battle without a capture, the player simply walks out of the tower.

Pokemon fans in the comments have shared their reactions to the clip, with the overall mood ranging from stunned to furious. Players lamented the loss of the Rayquaza, considering that most players would consider themselves extraordinarily lucky to encounter a Shiny version of it. Those fans said they felt "betrayed," while others pointed out that Shiny hunters would hate the player. Others were simply stunned that the fan was able to navigate the Sky Pillar so readily.

While this moment has upset some fans, others have pointed out that there's a strong likelihood that the Rayquaza was made Shiny through cheats. Others have noted that it may have been a tool-assisted run, which would explain the OP's ease of moving through the Sky Pillar, too. If that's the case, a lot of players wouldn't find it to be quite as upsetting, but more likely than not, the OP shared this clip to purposefully set off the community, which they've certainly succeeded in doing.

3 Images
3 Images

item.title: LEGO’s Darth Revan and Cal Kestis Teases are a Brutal One-Two Punch for Star Wars Games
item.description:
The following contains mild spoilers for both the Star Wars Jedi franchise and Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic ​​​​​​.

Canon this, canon that— Star Wars , maybe more than any other IP franchise of its gargantuan size, has always been concerned with what’s considered in-line with its established timeline, intimately wielding the Skywalker Saga as a baseline from which spin-offs and other series entries have then taken flight or stemmed from in a galaxy far, far away. That’s why, despite it still being a bit niche in the overall Star Wars fandom, the Disney+ show LEGO Star Wars: Rebuild the Galaxy can be seen as a breath of fresh air.

Namely, while LEGO Star Wars: Rebuild the Galaxy ’s four-part miniseries is largely another outlet for LEGO and Star Wars to collaborate, it is also one of the few opportunities that the IP has had to truly stretch its legs and indulge in whatever playful continuity or lore rewrites it wants. Now, with its second season, LEGO Star Wars: Rebuild the Galaxy - Pieces of the Past , scheduled to air on September 19, 2025, two more beloved Star Wars legends are joining the mix. Unfortunately, its adaptations of Star Wars Jedi ’s Cal Kestis and Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic ’s Darth Revan come at a time that’s bittersweet for both characters.

Star Wars Jedi is Thriving, But Not for Too Much Longer

It wouldn’t be overselling it to claim that Respawn’s Jedi series—thus far composed of Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order and Star Wars Jedi: Survivor —has done the most justice to the Star Wars brand than any related media, perhaps only dethroned by the popularity and excellence that the Disney+ show Andor displayed in its two seasons. Focusing almost entirely on its playable protagonist, Cal Kestis, Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order ’s story follows a Jedi Padawan refugee who flees from the Empire during the Jedi Purge and is enlisted by a crew of two to potentially aid in restoring the Jedi Order.

This first game ends with somewhat of a cliffhanger as Cal and Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order ’s Stinger Mantis crew, now complete with Nightsister Merrin and possibly an optional Bogling, choose not to pursue remaining Force-sensitive children so they’re hopefully not found by anyone, destroying the holocron that could lead Cal or anyone else to them.

In the sequel, Star Wars Jedi: Survivor , a time jump of five years occurs and the Stinger Mantis has since disbanded, with Cal encountering its members once again during the story’s events. Now, with one more game supposedly in the works that may conclude Cal’s narrative, it’s a shame that such a novel story in the Star Wars pantheon is coming to a close, and that’s why Cal appearing in LEGO Star Wars: Rebuild the Galaxy - Pieces of the Past is a massive boon.

It’s been rumored for quite a while that Cameron Monaghan’s Cal Kestis would make the jump from video games to live-action at some point, but this odd detour to LEGO animation will suffice as it officially means the character is being considered for Star Wars media beyond the Jedi games. Ironically, because the Star Wars Jedi series may be ending with its next game, LEGO Star Wars: Rebuild the Galaxy - Pieces of the Past ’s Cal is both a fun homage and a sad reminder that his chapter is nearly finished, at least as long as Star Wars is indecisive about what to do with the character in the meantime.

Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic is Seemingly Hanging on By a Thread

Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic ’s Darth Revan may be somewhat of a deep cut nowadays for any fans who only began diving into Star Wars in the last decade. Indeed, with so little about Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic having any kind of presence in the present day of the franchise, it wouldn’t be surprising if recent Star Wars enthusiasts weren’t all that familiar with the character.

However, as for the best Star Wars video games, there may not yet be one to have surpassed it in terms of its immaculate storytelling and worldbuilding, with Darth Revan in particular being a fascinating custom character with player-made choices affecting how their role in the universe unfolds. It’s highly likely that there’ll never be another Star Wars game like it or Star Wars Knights of the Old Republic 2: The Sith Lords —that is, aside from Saber’s Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic remake.

This remake has been through the wringer with a lot of tumultuous events detailing its development history so far, though, and, if it does somehow launch eventually, there’s an incredibly small likelihood that its release date will be at any time in the near future.

The Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic remake will hopefully be in the oven as long as it needs to be, so that its finished product is terrific. Meanwhile, it’s baffling and exciting to see that Darth Revan will make an appearance in LEGO Star Wars: Rebuild the Galaxy - Pieces of the Past , even if it does bring every single Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic remake development problem to the surface of memory.

LEGO Star Wars: Rebuild the Galaxy - Pieces of the Past may not be the balm that gamers need to tide them over for the next however many years it takes for light to be shed once more on Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic , yet it is a relief nonetheless that Darth Revan and BioWare’s Star Wars RPG have not been forgotten or abandoned in a broader sense while the Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic remake has understandably gone dark and Saber is tasked with remaking one of the greatest Star Wars games to have ever existed. That’ll be no small feat to achieve, but LEGO Star Wars: Rebuild the Galaxy - Pieces of the Past could be a lovely amuse-bouche for it if Saber does happen to succeed in its ambitious goal.

item.title: Battlefield 6 Players Criticize 'Completely Useless' Grenade Launcher
item.description:
Some vocal Battlefield 6 players are asking for changes to the grenade launcher, having labeled it as "largely useless." Similar criticism has simultaneously been aimed at Battlefield 6 's rocket launcher.

Battlefield 6 is currently in the midst of its second open beta weekend, which kicked off on August 14 and is scheduled to conclude this Sunday, August 17. Between this test and the one that preceded it, hundreds of thousands of players have had a chance to get first-hand experience with the upcoming shooter, leading to plenty of lively online discussion of the game's perceived strengths and weaknesses.

Battlefield 6 Players Frustrated With Grenade Launcher's AoE

Continuing this trend, some fans have recently banded together to criticize the way grenade launchers were balanced, calling them one of the worst Battlefield 6 open beta weapons. The main concern is their limited area of effect, which typically requires direct hits to secure kills, an interaction many consider unintuitive. While Battlefield 6 is not a military sim, it retains such a theme, and some fans argue the weapon’s perceived ineffectiveness clashes with that setting. In a recent widely circulated post, Reddit user Nameless908 called the grenade launcher "almost completely useless" while comparing it to a spitball pen.

Battlefield 6 open beta players have voiced similar complaints about the rocket launcher, which also lacks significant splash damage. Whenever the rocket doesn't connect with the enemy, it only serves to suppress them. Another one of its widely criticized traits concerns its inability to destroy walls or any other kinds of static structures (which also applies to grenade launchers), something that players intuitively expect would be possible. Both of these issues were illustrated near the beginning of a recent viral Battlefield 6 video by popular YouTuber Jason "videogamedunkey" Gastrow, around the 10-second mark.

The Case for Battlefield 6 Leaving Grenade and Rocket Launchers As Is

While there's currently no shortage of fan complaints about the way rocket and grenade launchers work, their limited AoE is almost certainly intentional. By nerfing their splash damage, DICE effectively turned them into niche anti-vehicle tools, discouraging their use against infantry. Moreover, the fact that players can equip two launchers already makes vehicles challenging to use in Battlefield 6 , so further increasing their AoE would risk upsetting this already delicate balance. Another thing to consider is that launchers have several types of ammunition, of which at least one—Thermobaric Grenades—works exceedingly well even without perfect aiming, stunning enemies while simultaneously setting them on fire.

DICE has so far given no indication of considering rebalancing rocket and grenade launchers. The developer still has some time to consider such tweaks before Battlefield 6 releases on October 10.
